Cough: Cough (either new or worsening/exacerbation of chronic cough)
DownloadAppDescription: Read the latest BC Government COVID-19 health guidance and keep your BC vaccine card and Federal COVID-19 Travel Proofs in a single place
Loss of sense of smell or taste: Loss of sense of smell or taste
Mild-title: Intermittent or occasional difficulty breathing with strenuous exercise or activities but doesnâ€™t interfere with daily activities.
Mild-desc: If your symptoms worsen or you are concerned, contact your primary care provider or call 8-1-1.
Moderate-title: Difficulty breathing during certain activities, for example walking to the bathroom or walking up stairs.
Moderate-desc: Please consult your family doctor or nurse practitioner as soon as possible. If you are unable to reach your regular care provider, seek care in an Urgent & Primary Care Centre (UPCC) or the nearest Emergency Department.
None-title: I actually don't have this symptom
Q1: Are you experiencing any of the following?
Q1-1: Severe difficulty breathing (e.g. struggling to breathe or speaking in single words)
Q1-3: Having a very hard time waking up
Q2: Are you experiencing any of the following?
Q2-1: Inability to lie down because of difficulty breathing
Q2-2: Chronic health conditions that you are having difficulty managing because of difficulty breathing
Q3: Are you experiencing new or worsening symptoms?
Q3-desc: Select the symptoms you have. If you are not experiencing any symptoms, select "None of the above."
Q3.5: What is the severity of your difficulty breathing?
Q3.5-desc: If you have any concerns, feel very sick, or your symptoms are not improving, contact your family doctor/nurse practitioner or call 8-1-1.
Q4: Have you received a new COVID-19 test result?
Q4-desc: If you have not entered it here before, please enter the details of your last COVID-19 test.
Q4-help: Sharing your COVID-19 test results enhances public health's understanding and response to COVID-19.
Q4-Enter the details: Please enter the details of your COVID-19 test:
Question: Question
ResultAsymptomatic: You do not need a COVID-19 test at this time.
ResultAsymptomaticDescription: If your symptoms change, retake this self-assessment to see if you need testing.
ResultAsymptomaticNotice1: If you have any questions or concerns, contact your health care provider or call <1>8-1-1</1>.
ResultAsymptomaticNotice2: For more information on COVID-19 and how to stay safe, visit the <2>BCCDC website</2>
Severe-title: Difficulty breathing that interferes with normal daily activities and persists at rest.
Severe-desc: Severe difficulty breathing (e.g. struggling to breathe or speaking in single words) requires immediate attention. Please call 9-1-1 immediately or go directly to your nearest emergency department.
